articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Health officials expand screenings for deadly coronavirus
articles.description: Federal health officials are expanding screenings for the deadly coronavirus to 20 ports of entry into the U.S. Meanwhile, the entire city of Wuhan is on lockdown. Dr. Jon LaPook reports.

articles.author: Kate Gibson
articles.title: FDA: Purell doesn't prevent the flu — or Ebola
articles.description: Regulators warn manufacturer against claiming that its hand sanitizer products can protect against viruses.
articles.content:
The U.S. Food and Drug Administration wants the maker of Purell to clean up its act, warning Gojo Industries to stop claiming that some of its hand sanitizers can help guard against Ebola, norovirus, the flu and other maladies.
The Ohio manufacturer makes un… [+2018 chars]

articles.author: Stephen Gandel
articles.title: Coronavirus misinformation spreads on Facebook
articles.description: Social media network has blocked only some users' posts that falsely claim U.S. is withholding a cure to deadly virus.
articles.content:
On Facebook, misinformation about the coronavirus that has killed more than 100 people in China continues to spread worldwide despite efforts and pledges by the social media company to eliminate fake news.
One post on Facebook says the U.S. has a patented va… [+4205 chars]

articles.author: Megan Cerullo
articles.title: Banks and tech firms tell employees to avoid traveling to China
articles.description: From Facebook to Goldman Sachs, big companies are taking measures to limit employees' exposure.
articles.content:
Multinational firms ranging from Facebook to Goldman Sachs are trying to curb their employees' exposure to the spreading coronavirus by restricting travel to China, where the epidemic started, and encouraging some staffers in Asia to work from home.
Facebook… [+3454 chars]

articles.author: Elizabeth Elkind
articles.title: Should Americans worry about coronavirus?
articles.description: The CDC issued its strongest travel warning, urging Americans to cancel all non-essential trips to China.
articles.content: As concern over the coronavirus grows, with over 100 possible cases in the U.S. and five confirmed, CBS News chief medical correspondent Dr. Jon LaPook told "CBS This Morning" that Americans should not panic. People who have never been to China or have not ha… [+1798 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Cases of coronavirus in China surge overnight; U.S. issues more travel warnings
articles.description: The CDC is strongly warning Americans to avoid all non-essential travel to China as the coronavirus continues to spread. At least 106 people have died and more than 4,500 have been infected. CBS News correspondent Ramy Inocencio joined CBSN with the latest on…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: CDC issues strongest coronavirus warning yet
articles.description: The CDC has issued its strongest travel warning yet, urging Americans to avoid all non-essential travel to China, where more than 100 people have died after getting the coronavirus. The virus has infected more than 4,500 and spreads from person to person. Hea…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Wisconsin family trapped in Wuhan amid coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: The United States will evacuate some Americans in Wuhan on a flight out of the quarantined city Wednesday morning.
articles.content:
The United States will evacuate some Americans in Wuhan on a flight out of the quarantined city Wednesday morning as concern over the spread of the coronavirus continues. But, there are roughly 1,000 Americans in the city and space is limited.
Sam Roth, a Wi… [+1647 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Wisconsin man hopes family can escape Wuhan as coronavirus panic grows
articles.description: A Wisconsin man is doing everything he can to get his wife and two children out of Wuhan, China, as the coronavirus death toll climbs to 106. The family is three of about 1,000 Americans stuck in the quarantined city. Ramy Inocencio reports on their chances o…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: What is the coronavirus from China and what are the symptoms?
articles.description: Officials in China and around the world are racing to contain the spread of a deadly new strain of virus.
articles.content: Officials in China are racing to contain a deadly new strain of virus that has infected more than 4,500 people and left at least 106 dead. Chinese officials have blocked all transportation in and out of the city of Wuhan and surrounding areas, where the outbr… [+5654 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Fear mounts as deadly new coronavirus spreads faster
articles.description: The coronavirus outbreak that started in central China has left at least 106 people dead and infected thousands around the world.
articles.content:
An American citizen stuck in Wuhan says panic is rising in the quarantined city of 11 million as the U.S. government works to get about 1,000 Americans reportedly stuck in the locked down metropolis out. 
"I just wish I could get my family off," Justin Steec… [+1449 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Americans urged not to travel to China over coronavirus concerns
articles.description: The U.S. State Department is raising its travel warning over the deadly coronavirus, urging Americans not to travel to China. At least five cases have been confirmed in the U.S. Adriana Diaz has the latest.
